channel.title: Free subversion repository hosting!
channel.description:
Hi guys. Those of you that use the IRC channels may have met TimGroe, a mate of mine. Anyway, he has been working on a website, called [url=http://sharesource.org/]ShareSource[/url], designed for developers like yourselves to organise and host open-source software projects.
ShareSource can be found at http://sharesource.org/
[url=http://sharesource.org/]ShareSource[/url] has several features:
[ul][li]Free subversion hosting for your projects[/li] [li]A bug tracker, which allows the submission of bugs found by users of your software[/li] [li]A version release system, which shows a snapshot of every version made to date[/li][/ul]
Signing up is very easy. Setting up a project is even easier. :) Project setup is achieved in just 4 simple steps. You can enable/disable features like the bug tracker or SVN snapshot page if you choose to. The only information required from you when creating a new project is the name of the project, a description of the project, and the type of project (basically what it's related to. eg: databases, networking).
There is only one requirement on your part - your project must be open-source, and it must use one of the open-source licenses listed below. Licenses that you may use when hosting your project on ShareSource include: * Academic Free License (v3.0) * Adaptive Public License (v1.0) * Apache Software License (v1.1) * Apache License, Version (v2.0) * Apple Public Source License (v2.0) * Artistic License * Attribution Assurance License * The BSD License * Computer Associates Trusted Open Source License * Common Development and Distribution License (v1.0) * Common Public License (v1.0) * CUA Office Public License Version (v1.0) * EU DataGrid Software License (v1.0) * Eclipse Public License (v1.0) * Educational Community License * Eiffel Forum License, (v1.0) * Eiffel Forum License, (v2.0) * Fair License * Frameworx Open License (v1.0) * GNU General Public License (GPL) (v2.0) * GNU General Public License (GPL) (v3.0) * GNU Lesser General Public License (GLGPL) (v2.1) * IBM Public License (v1.0) * Intel Open Source License for CDSA/CSSM Implementation * Jabber Open Source License (v1.0) * Lucent Public License (v1.0) * Lucent Public License (v1.02) * MIT License * Mozilla Public License (v1.0) * Mozilla Public License (v1.1)
Here are some screen shots:
The project summary page. This, obviously, displays the basic information for your project, such as developers working on it and the license it uses. [img]http://img263.imageshack.us/img263/8799/projectsummarytb9.png[/img]
This is the SVN snapshot page. [img]http://img178.imageshack.us/img178/452/svnsnapshotsof1.png[/img]

item.title: Free subversion repository hosting!
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Heh, I think I’m actually going to use this sharesource Just cuz I can’t be assed to make a sourceforge project

EDIT: http://sharesource.org/project/csrswebclient

Read full topic
